text:
PETER SARSGAARD: You have to
feel like you know what you're

doing in order for
people to believe
you know what you're doing.
That's really what it is.
It's like a kind of con game.
[music playing]

I think I wanted to
be a character actor
before I was a character actor.

You know, people
ask me, like, how--

why do you play creepy
people, or bad people,
or people who don't have jobs?
And you know, like, I think--

or people that are outcasts
in one way or another.

And I go, well, I
think it's because I--

looking back, I didn't present
myself that way to the world.
You know, I didn't--

that wasn't my
first step into it.
[music playing]

There's an acting coach
named Penny Allen who

passed away in the
spring who's the mentor
of many great actors.

And I don't want to
say which ones, mostly

because it almost felt
like working with Penny
that you had a cheat sheet.

I think a lot of actors think,
like, oh, I can't admit that I
was using that all the time.

But she was an
extraordinary woman.
[music playing]

The problem is, nobody
wants to see us play lovers,

and nobody is gonna believe
us as brother and sister.

So, we've only got, like,
a couple of parts left.

On stage, you know, there are
directors, there are writers,
there's all those people.

But when you step out on stage,
you can do whatever you want.

That's really the
ideal place for us

to perform together,
if what we want to do

is actually act
together, because we'll

get to do it every night,
through the whole thing.

Create it together,
let it change.

We go to do a
film, and you know,

we celebrate actors as being
somehow the makers of films.
Film is-- the directors do it.
TV, the writers do it.

Theater, the actors
are mostly responsible.

I know that Daniel Sullivan's
gonna, like, never hire me now,
but it's fine.
[music playing]
Comb your hair.
[music playing]

I never dreamed that my
life would be like this.
I had reasonable expectations.
This isn't my dream life.
This is like--

I just wake up every
day, and I'm shocked.
[music playing]
